imdb_user_reviews.contents: Hilarious; don't believe those hipsters and their high standards
"Jock? Will everything be alright in the end?"
Not marvelous but an amusing film
If Johnny Depp is having fun, then we should too.
Did I watch the same film?!
One of the worst movies I've ever seen!
A Fantastic Comedy and a Great Movie
Much laughs in a movie that doesn't hesitate to parody itself
Picaresque Mortdecai: British-style humor, entertaining and silly!
Mortdecai wants to join the ranks of comedic oddball characters like Mr. Bean and Clouseau, but comes off as embarrassing
One of the better movies starring Johnny Depp
I think you people just don't get it...
It IS Funny, it's just not written for the U.S. sense of humour.
Flamboyant Fun and that's all it needs to Be,
An Absurd Spoof that isn't for Everyone

One of the most pointless and aimless films ever made
"Kissing a man without a mustache is like eating an egg without salt."
No no no no. Just no.
two wonderful actors looking for a better film

Not a bad film, just a very boring one

The Thin Man and The Pink Panther

This film had its laughs, but had quite a few problems.
Mortdecai, though blessed with colorful cast and flowery script, is a poor man's Pink Panther
Tried to be a cross between a grown up Pink Panther mixed with Mr. Bean and ended up just being annoying.
Not the best of Johnny Depp
Paul Whitehouse is the only attraction.
Worst Johnny Depp Film...an Unfunny Embarrassment
Just don't bother watching this one.
The terrible, awful, no good, really bad MOVIE. ugh!
I'm afraid I was very very drunk...
Unbelievably poor film with no target audience
As horrible as Gwyneth's British Accent
Exasperatingly unfunny parody of retro spy flicks leads little to be desired
they said i wouldn't like it...

Not many laughs but not totally unwatchable
Not even the well assembled cast could make up for this poor attempt at an action comedy.
Johnny Depp no longer have to prove that it is more than a pretty face
Annoying rip-off that makes a buffoon out of itself
The abundance of negative reviews hide this fun gem!
Keep expectations VERY LOW, and it won't be that bad
Pink Panther + Johnny English + Dogshit = Mortdecai
Marvelous Mortecai! Lets's all start a cult following to tell everyone this is a very fine flick
Please let there be a sequel!
Laugh Out Loud (I tried to use the acronym, but the system called it a shouted spelling mistake -!)
The makings of a Classic British Heist film.
Depp should be concentrating on making better films!
Its supposed to fun movie and it is!!!
Comedies are supposed to make you laugh, yes?
I hope that smell of crap doesn't permeate all of 2015...
Not to be taken to seriously
A good film, which seems to need a smarter than average viewer
WARNING - DO NOT waste your time with this abomination.... that is all
Why did I waste my time on this film?
A worthy successor to Peter Sellers' Inspector Clouseau !
Happy I didn't pay to see this movie
Deserves a little more credit for a brave effort

are the critics just secretly jealous of Johnny Depp?
An eccentric Lord  Mortrtdecai  is commissioned to help MI5 (sic) to investigate a stolen painting
Simple comedy... Good for passing your time
A brilliant parody of British gentleman detective mysteries
Don't listen to all the haters
In the tradition of Connoisseur mustaches everywhere
America's attempt at British comedy, falls short.
Very decent and funny movie!!! Don't listen to spoiled haters.
*Spoilers* This movie is EXCELLENT - Ignore the Depp Haters
Went to the movie for Depp, but its an unfunny "Funny Movie"
Somewhat dreadful vanity piece for star Depp to get his ya-yas out and get in touch with his inner Terry-Thomas/Peter Sellers

Pirates of the Caribbean all over again
Harmless & entertaining: good fun for a good laugh.
You'll want your 2 hours back after viewing

johnny depp's version of the love guru

Mortdecai is a lot of fun!!!
This film wont waste your time
Starts of a bit annoying, but it definitely grows on you
Jonny Deep's acting is good but not the story

mc_pro_critic_reviews.summary: It’s exactly the sort of oddball trifle, like Hudson Hawk, that tends to attract the ire of baffled audiences and grumpy critics. It’s also the sort of oddball trifle that, like Hudson Hawk, will put certain aficionados of silliness in a pretty good mood.
The hard part will be convincing audiences to shake off their Depp fatigue and embrace a film that's daffy, dated, and precisely as intended.
Those who do find their way into this supremely silly action-mystery caper are in for a few grins if not laughs thanks largely to the deft — and daft — performance of Johnny Depp in the title role.

Mortdecai is by no means a disaster — the occasional joke lands, and there’s at least some fun to be found in the frenetic farce of all the conspiracies and the running-around... Still, I spent most of the movie waiting for it to find its rhythms and set a witty pace for itself that would allow the humor to build and the outrageous situations to pay off grandly.

Beyond stiff and halfhearted performances, tired and infantile comic material and a needlessly complicated plot, the real, truly piercing shortcoming of the movie is that it lacks a compelling reason to exist.

The story is nonsensical and the action tepid. So if you don’t find the Brit-quips funny, there’s not much for you in Mortdecai, just vintage British motorcars, foppish gibberish and Depp curling and re-curling that mustache, punctuating every line with “Right!” or “Quite!” That makes for a quite watchable mess.

The movie is too odd and randy to play for kids on an Austin Powers level, and too broad to really work as farce. But Depp, god bless him, fully commits, and finds a few genuinely funny moments amidst all the outsize mugging and mild sociopathy.
Contrary to appearances, Mortdecai isn’t a total disaster: Depp may be suffering the most catastrophic career slump since Eddie Murphy said yes to Norbit, but he’s still perfectly watchable.

With a varied wardrobe of retro men's finery and a hirsute upper lip, the title character of the silly comedy Mortdecai is the center of a whirlwind of horrible British accents, too much gagging, not enough good gags and weak dialogue that, while not exactly terrible, is terribly boring.
Mortdecai succeeds more as a talky farce than an action-packed adventure. But it would be even better if Mortdecai weren’t about Mortdecai at all.
There’s a fatal shortage of zingers to supplement its exhausting zaniness.
Charmless, mirthless and witless, this waste of time is another black mark on Depp’s card, while his co-stars fare little better. Even low expectations won’t help you here.

Most Americans will be unfamiliar with the late British writer Kyril Bonfiglioli’s Mortdecai novels, on which this Johnny Depp comedy is based; still, no reference point is required to come to the conclusion this is a rotten movie all around.

In the end, we must lay the badness of Mortdecai at the feet of its star. I envy Depp’s capacity for self-amusement, but it’s a pity he’s so rich and enbubbled that no one dares say to say to him, “Er, Johnny ... this is, er, really very bad.”

Mortdecai’s farcical mechanics are actually well worked out, which is a credit to Koepp, an ace Hollywood screenwriter (Jurassic Park, 2002’s Spider-Man) who directed the fun late-summer sleeper Premium Rush two years ago. It’s just the jokes that are astonishingly unfunny.
What a frantically dull spectacle this vanity project is.
Mortdecai is an anachronistic mess that never succeeds in re-creating the breezy tone or snappy rhythm of the classic caper movies that it aims to pastiche.
A psychotically unfunny art-heist romp.

One of those rare birds that is so off-putting in so many ways that all I could do for the most part was wonder how so many presumably intelligent people could be persuaded to sign on to produce and appear in something that could not have possibly seemed like anything other than a total mess from its earliest stages.
Mortdecai is mortdifying, a mortdal sin of a movie that’s headed for the cinematic mortduary.
Johnny Depp has done so much for us. Let us now return the favor and pretend Mortdecai, a disastrously misjudged career low, never existed.

mc_user_reviews.text: At times it is a delightfully oddball little film. However that quirky weirdness is also what is going to drag the film down for many. It's humor and style are just too British to appeal to everyone. But those looking for a goofy adventure in the vein of the Pink Panther films can find something to enjoy here.
Despite all the negative reviews, I found it very funny.

There's an alarming trend of steady decline in quality of Johnny Deep's movies. He performs to his strength as quirky characters, but his recent movies haven't been optimal even with the help of talented cast. Mortdecai is probably the worst of the bunch, an insipid action comedy that fails in creating sophisticated humor, needlessly complicated and above all, dangerously boring.
Oh my god January is almost over...thank the **** lord, but first I have to review this peace of cinematic trash With Johnny Depp in it, oh boy.
I have to say, i can't see how this got so many bad reviews. I loved it! Funny, witty and stupid (in a good way). Too intelligent for some people maybe?
Sweet mother of god! How much **** money does this industry have to flush down the nearest toilet? Not a single laugh, left half way through, save your money and don't go.

I don't get a great thrill from going after a movie, but the sheer waste of talent and contempt for the moviegoing public that resides at the heart of "Mortdecai" is unreal.  Nobody could have thought this was a good idea while they were making it - it's a showcase for Johnny Depp to mug and overact in every scene he's in.  Everyone else in the film is supposed to be his straight man while he runs around acting like a lunatic. I cannot understand why this film was made or why $60 million was spent on its production.  It absolutely deserves a 0 out of 10 - there's not a laugh in it.  What does exist is a conceit to make a '60s caper comedy without a semblance of a plot, wit, or momentum - Johnny Depp in full gesticulation is supposed to make up for all of that.  Embarrassed for all involved except for Johnny Depp, who clearly knew what he was doing - and did it anyway.  Haven't seen a movie this poor, this miscalculated in many years.  At least the moviegoing public has stayed away and spared themselves the abject boredom of sitting through this disaster.

It really is hard to believe how this film turned out so bad. Great cast, good screenwriter and cult source material have been mixed together to create one of the most self indulgent, poorly executed and unfunny comedies in recent memory. Depp plays the title character as a cross between Terry Thomas and a Fast Show character, while the rest of the cast orbit him mugging desperately for the camera to try and get noticed. A cinematic disaster of epic proportions
I thought this movie was going to suck from the moment I watched the trailer. It provided a few smiles but no laughs. It wasn't a very good time at all.

Mortdecai is definitely underrated.  The laughs are underrated and Johnny Depp is underrated. For me, it was a fun movie for whatever it is. Its not the best comedy choice and not the best choice for adults with no sense of british humor. The spy concept was good, and I think it gave it an edge to the film. Ewan and Gwyenth were good in supporting roles, but the main surprise was Depp as a british, cocky, sleek and well mustached Mortdecai. Its  fun film with forgivable flaws. Mortdecai deserves a watch on the big screen. Its wild, big and funny.
This film was witty, funny and silly - intentionally - throughout. It reminded me of the first Austin Powers film. Don't believe the haters. They are too uptight to appreciate a film such as this.

"Mortdecai" (2015) has a sense of humor throughout but it does not feature enough laughs to qualify as "funny". It is entertaining yet disappointing with some kind of style, great ensemble cast but an indifferent plot.

I went into Mortdecai expecting a terrible film, but I left the theater with a smile on my face. This film made me laugh more then I thought and it was actually enjoyable. The critics hated this film, and I usually agree with critics, but I had a lot of fun with Mortdecai. Johnny Deep gives his best performance since Pirates of the Caribbean, and his mustache is a lot less annoying then I thought it would be prior to seeing this film. I still don't understand the R rating, since there are only 2 f-words in the film, and no nudity. I would love to see a sequel since it is my understanding that the book has sequels, so hopefully it'll make money this weekend. I think it deserves a watch if you want to be entertained.
Funny. It was funny. Full theater, near-constant laughter, and applause at the end. These negative reviews... they really confuse me.
A decent looking film that seems adequately directed. It just needed more jokes. I never felt more disconnected from such a nice looking movie as I have with this one.

This movie was a great adaptation.  The critics spoke badly of this movie even before the public had a chance to see it.  This character has great potential as a franchise similar to the great Pink Panther series.  I left the theatre with a smile on my face and wanting more.

Great film!  Paul Bettany has loads of fun with JD. Paul Whitehouse does a great cameo, effing and blinding just as in the subtly sophisticated books by Kyril Bonfiglioli on which it is based. The whole audience was laughing hard. The critics don't get it, maybe just flies over their heads.  Some Brits won't like it as it mocks them mercilessly. But take em down I say!

Johnny Depp is known for his eccentric interpretations, which can be marvelous or, in this case, an awkward flop. He plays an upper crust rogue and art scammer with a stupid moustache. There's an unoriginal plot about a stolen painting, but the focus is on his character's supposedly hilarious hijinks and clueless charms. NOT ONE JOKE lands and the supporting cast of impressive talent has taken his lead and avoided all attempts at being funny. The dry direction doesn't offer any help. A new low for Depp.

Like watching a clown drink himself to death then this movie is for you. Devoid of any sense of humor or comedic timing full of perverse writing equal to the horror of your balls being rendered apart with a fork.

I was so disappointed with this movie, I even went out of the theater with both hands on my face, ashamed that I had to see Johnny Depp this way. Ewan Mcgregor did his part way better. I could say that it's one of the worst movies from Depp, ever. Don't even watch it at home, it's that bad.

Much better than I expected. If you are not into corky silly movies, this is NOT for you. Think "Pirates in Caribbean" meet the "Pink Panther". Underrated movie, I find that the seriously cynical and uptight, tend to hate it.

Despite the bad press I have found this an incredibly enjoyable film, as a fan of the Bonfiglioli novels, I found that whilst the film took liberties with the plot it was true to the spirit and flavour of the original books. Many of the the gags that I have seen criticised in the professional reviews are intact straight , word for word lifts from the novels. I do find it quite annoying the professional film critics write a bout a film based on a novel without bothering to first read the novel.  Many films of this ilk are hammered for NOT being true to the original and this one is being panned for  doing so, damned if one does damned of one doesn't. I understand that this film will probably be completely incomprehensible to most American audiences, and one criticism that I do have is that the film is weakened by the attempts to make it more accessible,  the producers should I believe have gone all out and made a film for British audiences and hopped that it transferred (" Four Weddings", "Downton Abby", etc).

Depp's character is a rehashed Pirates of the Carribean accent, with the flare of Mr Bean facial contortions. Rare moments, thru the intensely-heavy dialogue, there were moments to chuckle.On the surface, chasing a round the world for something sounds exciting, but in general the movie was not very interesting. There are times when quirky is funny and this movie was not.

Mortdecai relies a bit too much on slapstick to be considered witty, and a bit too much on its magnificent (on paper) cast to impress us. After all, the silliness of the act is undeniable, but it's the kind of silliness a child would like.
Unfortunately  Johnny Depp become so much cliche and unsightly. this movie have something like 2 ou 3 good and fun scene. Every thing else are horrible.

I loved this film because of it fun,lighthearted silliness. Just what is needed sometimes when life seams to be thick with hate and brutality. Films are about their ability to take someone to a place they have never been or away from what they would like to forget. To escape today's realty. Today this film was a blast, exactly what I needed, some light silly positive comedy where the biggest problem was a silly mustache. A perfect movie after a dark tragic day of Paris killings. And it allowed me to forget and escape for that time, which are what movies sometimes are all about!

Made me laugh, but its ability of doing so doesn't make it great. The plot is not so interesting, and the characters are predictable, and their actors don't surprise much on their acts as much as we already know from them. I left the movie theatre feeling entertained with the chuckles I had, but feeling that I'd just watched a poor movie in its content.
Most not-british british comedy. Despite nice actors - movie is boring, unfanny, bad in general. Things like this happens, when americans trying to do british humor.
The very definition of average.

Without a doubt, one of the worst Johnny Depp films I've ever seen. Makes "Dark Shadows" look like a masterpiece. If I was Depp, I would be very ashamed, as should all the other fine actors involved in this trash.

Johnny Depp continues his career downfall with Mortdecai, giving his worst and most pathetic performance of his career. How can an Actor with this much raw talent waste his time in such a terrible film? It wastes the talent of its cast, it wastes the audience time in a muddled mess that fails to be anything that it was going for.

Mortdecai is absolutely hilarious!  Depp was clearly influenced by Terry Thomas's English upper class buffoon character in his onscreen persona.  The film is packed with what must seem like endless inside jokes to those uninitiated or imperceptive to this brand of humor.  Therefore with this understanding it would seem highly likely that critics who shredded this film just did not get it.  If you can't stand sitcoms, have watched more than Sesame Street on PBS or simply enjoy subtler humor more often found in British films, then this film may be for you.

NOTE: I did not watch the entire film, I got up to the first hour and five minutes and I just gave up immediately. The only other movies I have never finished watching before were 'Catwoman' (2004) and 'The Human Centipede 2 (Full Sequence)' (2011). Already, this is not a good sign for 'Mortdecai'.

Finally, i watched Mortdecai and i agree that is a low point to Deep's career, however i don't think it's that bad and it's probably my "guily pleasure", but The Lone Ranger or Transcendence were even worse...it reminds me of a british spy movie and somehow Deep quickly reminded me of Rowan Atkinson. This movie is a little strange but i really have fun with some jokes, but another just simply were flat and obvious...I think the biggest problem with it is that the sequences were much longer and they just put some scenes unecessary that makes the story go slowly. I think people are only making this movie a disaster because of Deep, who as always and no matter the movie, is great  but i want to see him as a real actor and not a caricature or a simple copy of Jack Sparrow, and the supporting actors like Paltrow, McGregor and especially Bettany are good additions...At the end, is not a disaster that many say, but i can understand because it has some fun but was stupid like that "balls scene" and even boring. All i can say is, it's forgettable but still enjoyable enough...

This movie is getting a bad rep from critics, but it is actually a very funny movie. It was not great from a technical aspect, but I found myself laughing in many parts, and even busting out laughing in some. I liked Paul Bettany and Jeff Goldblum, but everyone else was annoying. So check this out despite what critics say.

Basado en la trilogía escrita por  Kyril Bonfiglioli, Charlie Mortdecai, es un lord Británico, tratante de arte, timador, bigotudo sensual,que se encuentra en la ruina, solo un golpe de suerte y el robo de un misterioso cuadro perdido Goya, puede sacarlo a él y a su esposa de su hecatombe económica.
Reasonably okay movie, with funny scenes here and there. Conversation was noteworthy funny too. Not so much on character development apparently.

loved the cast, positive vibes, good laugh for those who want to! smart lines, witty dialogues, if you are seeking to have fun with silly dispositions then you will love it. can understand why so many bad comments.
The two or three good jokes that the film has are immediately overshadowed by Johnny Depp's over the top performance and horrible English accent.[full review in Spanish]

Absolutely terrible. This is for sure johnny depps worst movie. I watched about 30 minutes of it and finally thought i had enough of this nonsense they call a movie. The script was awful yet the plot seemed intriguing. After seeing depp in finding neverland and the pirates of the Caribbean films I know he can do better and feel very sorry he got stuck in such an awful movie. Avoid at all costs

Basado en la trilogía escrita por  Kyril Bonfiglioli, Charlie Mortdecai, es un lord Británico, tratante de arte, timador, bigotudo sensual,que se encuentra en la ruina, solo un golpe de suerte y el robo de un misterioso cuadro perdido Goya, puede sacarlo a él y a su esposa de su hecatombe económica. Y si, en efecto, nos encontramos ante la nueva película de Johnny Depp, donde se aleja de los blockbusters ultramillonarios, de Tim Burton y de cualquier película con dignidad y se rebaja a participar y producir un subproducto rancio, anacrónico y patético.

An entertaining , laughable movie, i wonder why neither critics nor users haven't been impressed by it. The performances were quite good , specially johnny depp's , who i do not understand why became nominee of golden raspberry awards.
